qas.question: Layla and Majnun is an example of what kind of poetry?
Which era is Layla and Majnun from?
In what century does Layla and Majnun originate?
What kind of story is told in Shahnameh?

answers.text: a mythical and heroic retelling of Persian history

qas.question: What Arabic and Persian poetry dates to the 700's?
What was inspired by Romeo and Juliet?
What is the national epic of Persia?
Who wrote the national epic of Persia?

context: A famous example of <a0_0>Arabic poetry and Persian poetry<a0_0/> on romance (love) is <b6_0><b7_0>Layla and Majnun<b7_0/><b6_0/>, dating back to the <a1_0><b5_0>Umayyad<b5_0/> era<a1_0/> in the <a2_0>7th century<a2_0/>. It is a tragic story of undying love much like the later Romeo and Juliet, which was itself said to have been inspired by a Latin version of Layla and Majnun to an extent. <a4_0><b9_0>Ferdowsi<a4_0/>'s<b9_0/> <b8_0>Shahnameh<b8_0/>, the national epic of Iran, is <a3_0>a mythical and heroic retelling of Persian history<a3_0/>. Amir Arsalan was also a popular mythical Persian story, which has influenced some modern works of fantasy fiction, such as The Heroic Legend of Arslan.
